sentences.en: An ion may be noticeably displaced from its lattice position.
sentences.cn: 离子都可能显著地偏离它的位置.

sentences.en: He was noticeably slow to respond.
I am starting to bald noticeably.
sentences.cn: 我头顶明显地开始变秃了.

sentences.en: Morrison took the news badly and from then on his spirits noticeably sagged.
sentences.cn: 这消息对莫里森打击很大，从那以后，他明显萎靡不振。

sentences.en: She has one slightly withered leg, noticeably thinner than the other.
sentences.cn: 她有一条腿有点儿萎缩，看上去明显比另一条腿瘦。

sentences.en: She is noticeably thinner after her illness.
Standards of living were deteriorating rather noticeably.
sentences.cn: 生活水平下降得十分明显。

sentences.en: The animals had lost weight noticeably, becoming lean, almost emaciated.
sentences.cn: 那些动物体重明显下降, 瘦多了, 简直是憔悴不堪.

sentences.en: The articles are noticeably shorter with strong headlines and graphics.
sentences.cn: 这些文章明显短了许多，并且配上了醒目的标题和图表。

sentences.en: The new player was a shot in the arm for the team , which played noticeably better.
sentences.cn: 新来的运动员给这个队以鼓舞的力量, 这个队明显地有了起色.

sentences.en: Their house was noticeably warmer than ours.
sentences.cn: 他们的房子明显比我们的暖和.

sentences.en: There are also many physical signs, most noticeably a change in facial features.
sentences.cn: 还有很多体貌特征，最明显的是面容的变化。

sentences.en: There was one boy rather noticeably standing apart from the other children.
sentences.cn: 有个男孩引人注目地独自站在一边,不接近其他孩子.

sentences.en: With the approach of spring the days begin to draw out quite noticeably.
sentences.cn: 春天临近,白昼明显地越来越长了.

words.tran_cn: 著名的；显著的；附有乐谱的
显而易见的，显著的；值得注意的
注意；记下（note的过去式和过去分词）
显著地，明显地；引人注目地
